H0.text: Kilometers are the units used to measure great distances in space.

H1.text: Light years are used to measure great distances in space.

H2.text: Megameters are the unit used to measure great distances in space.

H3.text: Astronomical units are the units used to measure great distances in space.

A4.text: Distances to objects such as quasars and the Sloan Great Wall run into the billions of light-years.

A5.text: Distances between objects within a star system tend to be small fractions of a light-year, and are usually expressed in astronomical units.
